Fsm
Class Action

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Fsm.Action
public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class is used to define the method to execute when a Transition is made. The only method for which you must provide a concrete implementation is:

execute(FSM f, Event e)

This method is passed the FSM and Event that caused the Transition. The Action.execute() method may access the FSM to get current State and then retrieve any persistent information associated with that State.

This method may also generate another event by invoking the FSM.doEvent() method.

execute

public abstract void execute(FSM f,
                             Event e)
This method is invoked whenever the corresponding transition occurs. You may access the FSM to get current State and then retrieve any persistent information associated with that State.
Parameters:
f - FSM containing this transition
e - Event that caused this transition
